docTitle.titlePart:
Preparation of polyvinylcarbazole thin film with vapor deposition
polymerization

byline.docAuthor: Masao Tamada a, Hideki Omichi a, Norimasa Okui b

byline.affiliation: a Tukasaki Radiation Chemistry Research Establishment, Japan Atomic Energy Research Institute,
b Department of Organic and Polymer Materials, Tokyo Institute of Technology,

front.div:
Abstract
N-vinylcarbazole (NVCz) was evaporated toward a substrate of a glass slide coated with silver 100 nm thick with the existence of a red-
heated filament. The processes of vapor deposition polymerization (VDP) and annealing were observed with in-situ infrared reflection
absorption spectroscopy. The filament temperature of 2300 K and the substrate temperature of 266 K were effective to retard the re-evaporation
of deposited NVCz. After NVCz was deposited on the above conditions and then annealed at 285 K, the resulting VDP film had a number
average molecular weight of 1.1 X lo4 and a polymer yield of 88%.
front.keywords: Keywords: Deposition process; Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy; Physical vapour deposition; Polymers
